sections.purpose: To store temperature-sensitive reagents and samples at 2°C to 8°C.
sections.scope: Applicable to storage activities in Pharmaceutical Analysis.
procedure: Verify the temperature setting on the digital thermostat.
Place reagents in labeled, sealed containers on the shelves.
Organize items to allow for uniform cold air distribution.
Monitor and record the temperature on the daily log sheet.
Check for expired reagents and dispose of them monthly.
Clean the interior surfaces with a mild disinfectant periodically.
Ensure the door is kept closed and the seal is functional.
Document any deviations from the set temperature range.
precautions: Do not store food or drinks in the laboratory refrigerator.
Minimize the duration of door openings.
Do not store flammable solvents in a non-explosion-proof unit.
Ensure all liquid containers have secondary containment.
Maintain a clear inventory of all stored items.
